title: A promising Internet satellite is rendered useless by power supply issues
description: "The mission of providing Internet connectivity in Alaska will be delayed."

title: Zyxel users still getting hacked by DDoS botnet emerge as public nuisance No. 1
description: 12 weeks after critical vulnerability was patched, devices are still being wrangled.

title: This LiDAR-equipped, 30-pound robot dog can be yours for $1,600
description: It's not quite as good as a Boston Dynamics bot, but it is a lot cheaper.

title: IMAX emulates PalmPilot software to power Oppenheimer’s 70 mm release
description: IMAX TikTok shows an emulated Palm PDA controlling Oppenheimer's 600-lb reel.

title: New legged robots designed to explore planets as a team
description: Even if one robot fails, the rest of the team can offset its loss.

description: "You are not the only thing standing between this and the universe."

title: OpenAI, Google will watermark AI-generated content to hinder deepfakes, misinfo
description: Seven companies promised Biden they would take concrete steps to enhance AI safety.

title: Redditors prank AI-powered news mill with “Glorbo” in World of Warcraft
description: "Glorbo" isn't real, but a news-writing AI model didn't know it—and then it wrote about itself.

title: 69% of Russian gamers are pirating after Ukraine invasion pushback
description: Russian game development jobs also dry up after Russia's actions.

title: The next Mazda MX-5 Miata might be an electric vehicle
description: The next MX-5 is a couple of years away and will have some kind of e-motor.

title: Infant deaths surge in Texas after abortion ban
description: The increase in deaths reverses a nearly 10-year decline.

title: Banks serving as guinea pigs for Federal Reserve’s instant payments system
description: The Fed's goal is to connect 9,000 financial institutions nationwide.

title: Dolphin emulator abandons Steam release plans after Nintendo legal threat
description: But dev team says including Wii decryption key doesn't put it in "any legal danger."

title: The ‘90s Internet: When 20 hours online triggered an email from my ISP’s president
description: 1998 plea for restraint reveals a lost world where the 'Net was an opt-in experience.

title: Rocket Report: Space Force to pick three; Pythom strikes back
description: "With this mission we’ve made big strides toward reusability."

title: Could there be upsides to being a psychopath?
description: It may be that all of us have a little psychopathology inside—with some positives.
